result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam K Jacobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONDITIONS OF PROBATION APPLY TO BOTH COUNTS.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No contact with T.L.J..  Contact with victim to be left to the probation agents discretion and pursuant to any current family court order.   Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: CIB records request     (documents emailed to DOJ on 10/26/21 at 4:05 pm)

Defendant Adam K Jacobson in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Jessica Allen present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews letter from Atty Meier requesting PRH.  Atty Meier makes statement regarding situation defendant is having regarding visitation of his children.  Court makes statement, doesn't control the Dept. of Corrections and their rules.  State mirrors Atty Meiers statement. Agent Allen makes statement. Court not taking any action, not here to tell DOC what to do. Nothing further needed today.
Probation review hearing on December 4, 2017 at 08:45 am.
Letter to Judge Ehlers requesting Probation Review Hearing

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Defendant Adam K Jacobson in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. State files Amended Information, gives plea agreement. Defense waives reading of the Amended Information. Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 30, 2017 at 08:45 am.
Letter to Judge Ehlers, Oct 17, 2017
Document from Dr. Thompson as requested by Atty Meier. (sealed by the Court)
from Motion Hearing dated 6/22/17
Def. Exh. 1 - CV of Dr. David Thompson, Exh. 2 - Report from Dr. Thompson. Both exhibits received by the court.

Defendant Adam K Jacobson in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews State's motion to limit or exclude expert testimony. Atty Meier has the burden of proof, offers Exh. 1 - CV of Dr. David Thompson and Exh. 2 - report of Dr. Thompson. Both exhibits received by the court. Dr. David Thompson sworn, testifies by phone. Recess 10:15 am. Back in session 10:26 am. Testimony continues with Dr. Thompson. Cross by ADA Korb. Atty Meier makes statement on motion. State gives argument. Court denies State's motion to limit or exclude expert testimony. Because of the difficulty of getting Dr. Thompson to testify, Atty Meier requests he be allowed to call Dr. Thompson on the afternoon of 1/31/18. Court will hear Dr. Thompson's testimony the afternoon of 1/31/18, State to plan accordingly. Atty Meier brings up issue of Atty Korb being a possible witness and whether she'll be taking herself off the case. Court indicates that issue needs to be decided within the next 30 days. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Adam K Jacobson in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews defendant's motion in limine. Discussion regarding motion. Court makes rulings on motion. Discussion regarding witness testimony. Court withholds ruling on that issue today, would like to review case law before issuing decision. Discussion re: court officer at counsel table. Court would like counsel here at 8:00 on jury date to take care of any issues that may have come up before trial starts. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Adam K Jacobson appears by phone along with attorney Rick Brian Meier who appears in person.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews motions filed by counsel, feels defense motion is two fold. State indicates any statement victim gave to law enforcement is part of discovery, treatment records are not. Defense/Court in agreement. Court addresses second part of motion.  Atty Meier makes statement.  State gives argument. Court makes statement, will review counseling records of victim from March 2016 through Mary 26, 2016. Court orders those records be released for courts review. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Adam K Jacobson in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, review State's motion and Defendant's objection. State makes statement, asks court to admit other acts evidence. Defense gives argument. asks court to deny motion to admit other acts evidence. State responds. Court makes statement, denies State's motion at this point as case in chief. If issue brought up when defendant testifies, Court will then allow State to bring in other acts. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Adam K Jacobson in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Meier asks that matter be set for pretrial and trial. (trial date to be scheduled in February-3 days) Discussion regarding an evidentuary hearing is needed before trial. State will file motion within the next week. When motion is filed, JA to contact Atty Meier to schedule motion hearing.

Defense waives reading of Information and stands mute on the charges. Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. Bond remains as is.

State Exh. 1 & 2 - photo's of home. Offered and received.

Defendant Adam K Jacobson in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests sequestration of witnesses. State designates Sgt. Zager as court officer.  Testimony taken from Officer Michelle Wiegand, sworn. State Exh. 1 & 2 - photo's of home. Offered and received. Sgt. Greg Zager testifies, sworn. Cross. Atty Meier renews motion for court to allow victim to testify. Court denies motion. Court finds probable cause that felony was committed and probable cause that defendant committed that felony and binds over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 08:45 am.
from ADA Korb requesting to reschedule the 6/22/16 preliminary hearing as Officer Wiegand is not available that day. Court reschedules.
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Adam K Jacobson in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews State's motion to quash subpoena and Atty Meier's response to that motion. Atty Korb makes statement on motion. Atty Meier responds. Court feels State's motion is premature, victim hasn't been subpoenaed yet. If Atty Meier does subpoena the victim, court will be quashing that subpoena without another hearing prior to the preliminary hearing. Bond remains in effect.

Court amends bond to allow supervised contact with IGJ and AKJ only, pursuant to the temporary order in 07-FA-91. No contact with TLJ or any juvenile females under age 18 remains in effect. Not to discuss case with daughters. Absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Adam K Jacobson in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews motion from Atty Meier to modify defendants bond. Court questions where case is at. Atty Meier asks court to set matter for a preliminary hearing. Court addresses bond motion. Atty Meier makes statement on motion. Atty Korb responds, State is still objecting to modification of the bond.  Atty Meier responds to State's argument. Court amends bond to allow supervised contact with IGJ and AKJ only, pursuant to the temporary order in 07-FA-91. No contact with TLJ or any juvenile females under age 18 remains in effect. Not to discusses case with daughters. Absolute sobriety from alcohol.
